message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. After a splenectomy, patients are at an increased risk for infections, particularly from encapsulated organisms such as Streptococcus pneumoniae. Therefore, the 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine should be administered. Inactivated influenza vaccine is recommended annually for all individuals over 6 months of age. Measles-mumps-rubella vaccine is generally given in childhood and is not necessary in this case. Tetanus booster vaccine should be given every 10 years, but it is not the most urgent vaccine in this situation.
